channel.title: Would you do it?
channel.description:
Saw this on reddit:
For a large amount of money(lets say a billion) would you play a game of russian roulette from a six shot chamber?

item.title: Would you do it?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Most likely, yes. The odds are too good and if you fail you’re not going to know about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you do it?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

I guess the real question is…am I the one pulling the trigger? and where is the money located at the time this happens?

Read full topic

item.title: Would you do it?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ambokile:

What you said about being able to choose is still irrelevant…

NO. You contradicted the truth by saying you can only have one round.

item.title: Would you do it?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

What you said about being able to choose is still irrelevant (and wrong)…

I only read the OP and your post, but if there are 6 rounds in it then it’s not Russian Roulette.

item.title: Would you do it?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:14, topic:514889”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=633139.msg4279810#msg4279810 date=1365374742]

Yes casey I would put a 6 shooter with 6 rounds in it to my forehead and pull the trigger. I’d certainly hope that the 1% chance that it jams would be in my favor. I’d have better chances buying 10 lottery tickets.

You’re stupid. You put 1 round in and leave 5 empty so you have a 1/6 chance.

You actually can pick how many you put in, more rounds you put in, the higher the winnings. You sir are the idiot, you piece of worthless manure.
[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Russian roulette

Russian roulette (Russian: русская рулетка, russkaya ruletka) is a lethal game of chance in which a player places a single round in a revolver, spins the cylinder, places the muzzle against his or her head, and pulls the trigger. "Russian" refers to the supposed country of origin, and roulette to the element of risk-taking and the spinning of the revolver's cylinder, which is reminiscent of a spinning roulette wheel. Because only one chamber is loaded, the player has a one in x chance of being ...

Russian roulette is a potentially lethal game of chance in which a player places a single round in a revolver, spins the cylinder, places the muzzle against his head, and pulls the trigger.

player places a single round in a revolver

places a single round

single round

single[/quote]

tyb97:

How many rounds in the revolver?[/quote][quote=“casey., post:9, topic:514889”]@Ty-6

[/quote][quote=“casey., post:9, topic:514889”]@Ty-6[/quote]
[/quote][quote=“casey., post:9, topic:514889”][size=14pt]@Ty-6[/size][/quote]
[/quote][quote=“casey., post:9, topic:514889”][size=24pt]@Ty-6[/size][/quote]
[/quote][quote=“casey., post:9, topic:514889”][size=36pt]@Ty-6[/size][/quote]

Read full topic

Russian roulette

Russian roulette (Russian: русская рулетка, russkaya ruletka) is a lethal game of chance in which a player places a single round in a revolver, spins the cylinder, places the muzzle against his or her head, and pulls the trigger. "Russian" refers to the supposed country of origin, and roulette to the element of risk-taking and the spinning of the revolver's cylinder, which is reminiscent of a spinning roulette wheel. Because only one chamber is loaded, the player has a one in x chance of being ...

Russian roulette is a potentially lethal game of chance in which a player places a [b]single round[/b] in a revolver, spins the cylinder, places the muzzle against his head, and pulls the trigger.
